Generated: 2025-08-24 11:48:19
Employee ID: zjzfl8v9bivldlkcv

MEDICAL RECORDS & RECOMMENDATIONS:
--------------------------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Judy you have a few positive risk factors - your weight and increased waist circumference, family history of diabetes and hypertension and mildly elevated cholesterol
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Supplement with DHEA
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Judy you have a few positive risk factors - your weight and increased waist circumference, family history of diabetes and hypertension and mildly elevated cholesterol
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.

Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Working out with a trainer 4 x a week
Lost nearly 6kg's since your medical last year and about 7cm around your waist!
Coping better with stress and drinking much less - well done!
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.

Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.

Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------

Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.

Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Clinically well but overweight. Small mole on her thigh and ?lipoma below left buttock.
Is seeing her gynae next week for annual check.

------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Clinically well but overweight. Small mole on her thigh and ?lipoma below left buttock.
Is seeing her gynae next week for annual check.
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Clinically well but overweight. Small mole on her thigh and ?lipoma below left buttock.
Is seeing her gynae next week for annual check.
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Judy you have a few positive risk factors - your weight and increased waist circumference, family history of diabetes and hypertension and mildly elevated cholesterol
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Clinically well but overweight. Small mole on her thigh and ?lipoma below left buttock.
Is seeing her gynae next week for annual check.

Employee: Judy Kobus

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.

------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------

Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations:

Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.

------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.

Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.

Comment Key: EyesightNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Judy you have a few positive risk factors - your weight and increased waist circumference, family history of diabetes and hypertension and mildly elevated cholesterol

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D

Increased BMI and waist circumference

Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D
Slightly increased total and LDL cholesterol with low HDL
Increased hsCRP
Increased BMI and waist circumference
Low DHEA
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Deficient vitamin D, high hsCRP, slightly raised cholesterol
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.

Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Deficient vitamin D, high hsCRP, slightly raised cholesterol
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Deficient vitamin D, high hsCRP, slightly raised cholesterol
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Deficient vitamin D, high hsCRP, slightly raised cholesterol
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Deficient vitamin D, high hsCRP, slightly raised cholesterol
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Deficient vitamin D, high hsCRP, slightly raised cholesterol
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D
Slightly increased total and LDL cholesterol with low HDL
Increased hsCRP
Increased BMI and waist circumference
Low DHEA
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.

Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Working out with a trainer 4 x a week
Lost nearly 6kg's since your medical last year and about 7cm around your waist!
Coping better with stress and drinking much less - well done!
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: You report no current chronic lifestyle conditions. Maintaining good habits (nutrition/ exercise/ stress reduction) will help reduce your future risk and possible complications. You’ve already been doing great work in these areas.
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: You report no current chronic lifestyle conditions. Maintaining good habits (nutrition/ exercise/ stress reduction) will help reduce your future risk and possible complications. You’ve already been doing great work in these areas.

Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.

------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Men's Health Recommendations:

Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Judy you have a few positive risk factors - your weight and increased waist circumference, family history of diabetes and hypertension and mildly elevated cholesterol
Comment Key: MentalHealthAnxietyRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: MentalHealthAnxietyRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: MentalHealthAnxietyRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Clinical Recommendations:

Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.

Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: MentalHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: MentalHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.
Comment Key: MentalHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: MentalHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Nil
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.

------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.

Comment Value: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationNote
Comment Value: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationNote
Comment Value: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D
Slightly increased total and LDL cholesterol with low HDL
Increased hsCRP
Increased BMI and waist circumference
Low DHEA

Employee: Judy Kobus

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations:

Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.
