------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.

Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Judy you have a few positive risk factors - your weight and increased waist circumference, family history of diabetes and hypertension and mildly elevated cholesterol
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: VitalsNote
Comment Value: High BMI (obese range), increased waist circumference and waist to height ratio
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: VitalsNote
Comment Value: High BMI (obese range), increased waist circumference and waist to height ratio
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.

------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: VitalsNote
Comment Value: High BMI (obese range), increased waist circumference and waist to height ratio
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------

Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: VitalsNote

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: VitalsRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Judy you have a few positive risk factors - your weight and increased waist circumference, family history of diabetes and hypertension and mildly elevated cholesterol

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations:

Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.

Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Supplement with DHEA
Comment Key: WomensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Comment Key: WomensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: WomensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Increased cholesterol: try to manage with lifestyle alone. Eat a healthy diet, continue your exercise, lose weight, and manage your stress. Supplement with 2g per day of omega 3. The level has not increased from last year though and your HDL "good cholesterol" has increased which is great, probably from your increased exercise.
Comment Key: WomensHealthNote

------------------------------
Employee: Judy Kobus
Report Date: 2021-11-30
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Clinically you examine well with normal vitals. There were good blood pressure readings noted. Regular self breast examinations are important to detect any irregularities early. If any concerns, to consult your GP.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI and your waist circumference are high. Try to reduce your BMI to 25 and waist circumference to less than 88 cm.
Comment Key: WomensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal

Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.

Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Overweight but otherwise all special investigations normal
------------------------------

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are up-to-date with your screening (Mammogram/ Pap smear). Regular review helps to detect any abnormalities early & improves management outcomes. Another screening scan that to be done is a Bone Density. This can be done through any radiology department.
Overview Notes: Deficient vitamin D level: supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml. Vitamin D is not only important for your bones but also your mood and cognitive health. It is also has anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.

Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease and other chronic diseases. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, losing abdominal fat and supplementing with omega 3's and curcumin.
